greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: number of Motzkin paths by length and by number of humps.
comment: T(n,k) = number of Motzkin paths of length n containing exactly k humps. (A hump is an upstep followed by 0 or more flatsteps followed by a downstep.)
link: Zhuang, Yan. A generalized Goulden-Jackson cluster method and lattice path enumeration, Discrete Mathematics 341.2 (2018): 358-379. Also arXiv: 1508.02793v2.
example: T(5,2) = 5 counts FUDUD, UDFUD, UDUDF, UDUFD, UFDUD.
mathematica: Program: (Math'ca) a[n_, k_]/;k<0 || k>n/2 := 0; a[n_, 0]/;n>=0 := 1; a[n_, k_]/;1<=k<=n := a[n, k] = a[n-1, k] + Sum[a[n-r, k-1], {r, 2, n}]+Sum[a[r-2, j]a[n-r, k-j], {r, 2, n}, {j, k}] This recurrence counts a(n, k) by first return to ground level.
results.author: _David Callan_, Aug 01 2004
